name: summoner mittens
notes:
i knew i wanted to make this pattern free from the very start. it's inspired by the book cover for shadow & bones by leigh bardugo. i'm a huge fan of fantasy, and all i want is to share that love with others. so enjoy this pattern, and if you haven't read the book yet you should give it a try.

----

these mittens are knitted from the cuff, starting with a twisted rib, followed by a latvian braid, and then the two color pattern starts.

there are increases for the thumb gusset in order to make them fit the hand better.

the thumb is a knit in thumb. the pattern includes a link to a video tutorial.

needles: 2.5 mm / us 1.5 circular or double pointed needles (dpns)
gauge: 32 stitches x 36 rows (10x10 cm / 4x4 in blocked) 

yarn: fingering or sport weight wool yarn
(i often use j√§rbo 2 tr ull for mittens)
main color (mc): 200 meters / 219 yards
contrast color (cc): 100 meters / 109 yards

knitting with gauge according to pattern will give you a pair of mittens of the follow measuments:
circumference: 21 cm / 8.3 in
length: 26 cm / 10.2 in

you can easily change the size by going up or down a needle size or using a thicker or thinner yarn. note that changing needles or thickness of yarn may change amount of yarn needed.

i recommend meeting the following stitch gauges on 10cm / 4 in for larger mittens:
22 cm / 8.7 in circumference: 31 stitches
24 cm / 9.5 in circumference: 28 stitches
26 cm / 10.2 in circumference: 26 stitches
